head.name: TAN keywords for types of divisions
head.desc: Definitive list of key terms used for textual divisions.
head.change: Revised for 2019; added Quranic div types.
head.comment: Groups are applied to div types where it seemed clear that div types not falling under that group would be an aberration. Any div types that seem part of a group are not included if a sizeable portion of those div types would not be properly classed as being part of the group. For example, a comment is in most cases a kind of annotation. But it is possible for a comment to be made without any implied base text. Therefore the div type comment is not assigned the group "annotation".

item.name: act
item.desc: A division or unit of a theatre work, including a play, film, opera, and musical theatre

item.name: ad praeterea
item.desc: division used particularly by Thomas Aquinas

item.name: alphabetic entry
alphabetic section
item.desc: Applied to works that have alphabetical divisions.

item.name: apophthegm
saying
sententia
item.desc: Found in saying collections, e.g., the Apophthegmata patrum. This category encompasses a number of different terms that are sometimes differentiated, but are difficult for most people to distinguish.

item.name: apparatus criticus
critical apparatus
item.desc: Section of a critical edition, usually at the bottom of the page, indicating variant readings in the manuscript tradition

item.name: apparatus fontium
item.desc: Section of a critical edition, usually at the bottom of the page, indicating parallel textual sources

item.name: block quote
xhtml blockquote
item.desc: Equivalent to TEI <quote> that is not in mixed content.

item.name: book
item.desc: Conceptual book, not a physical one. For the physical one, see codex.

item.name: castlist
dramatis personae
tei castlist
item.desc: A list of cast members
= tei:castList

item.name: castlist item
tei castitem
item.desc: An entry within a castlist
= tei:castItem

item.name: castlist item actor
tei actor
item.desc: An actor mentioned in a castlist item
= tei:actor

item.name: castlist item role
tei role
item.desc: A role within a castlist item
= tei:role

item.name: castlist item role description
tei roledesc
item.desc: A role description within a castlist item
= tei:roleDesc

item.name: causa
item.desc: Division in medieval western literature

item.name: century
item.desc: A textual division that contains 100 chapters or segments.

item.name: clause (grammatical)
tei cl
item.desc: See also independent clause

item.name: dictum ante canonem
dictum ante capitulum
item.desc: Terminology used of medieval works, e.g., Gratian.

item.name: dictum post canonem
dictum post capitulum
item.desc: Terminology used of medieval works, e.g., Gratian.

item.name: distinctio
item.desc: Terminology used of medieval works, e.g., Gratian.

item.name: ennead
item.desc: A set of nine treatises, applied to the extant writings of Plotinus, or to imitative corpora.

item.name: entry
item.desc: A section in a larger work customarily called entries, e.g., an encyclopedia, a dictionary.

item.name: epilogue
item.desc: Some may equate this with postscript.

item.name: fragment
item.desc: A collection of fragments may be defined rather generally, to mean only direct quotations of a writing otherwise lost, or it may refer to paraphrases or summaries. If a distinction is made, use testimony for the latter.

item.name: half line (verse)
item.desc: Understood to be a semantic division, not a physical line break, for which see line (physical)

item.name: history
item.desc: Some literary works are composed of items called histories, e.g., pseudo-Nonnus, Scholia mythologica.

item.name: independent clause
item.desc: used to identify two or more sentence parts that have a subject and predicate and function as a sentence.

item.name: introduction
item.desc: Some may equate this type with prologue.

item.name: lemma (scholion)
item.desc: A word or phrase quoted from a text that is being annotated by a scholium.

item.name: note
tei note
item.desc: Notes placed anywhere, including footnotes and endnotes.

item.name: postscript
item.desc: Some may equate this with epilogue.

item.name: preface
item.desc: Some may equate this with prologue.

item.name: prologue
prolegomenon
item.desc: Some may equate this with introduction.
Some may equate this with preface.

item.name: respondeo
item.desc: division used particularly by Thomas Aquinas

item.name: scene
item.desc: A unit of action, often a subdivision of an act

item.name: section
item.desc: A generic block of text.

item.name: sed contra
item.desc: division used particularly by Thomas Aquinas

item.name: stanza
item.desc: Similar to TEI <lg type="stanza">

item.name: subchapter
item.desc: Divisions of a chapter, perhaps without name or label.

item.name: subsection
item.desc: Divisions of a section, perhaps without name or label.

item.name: testimony
testamentum
item.desc: A literary fragment where the author is only loosely quoted or paraphrased.

item.name: variant
variation
item.desc: An alternative rendition of a passage. It is assumed that every variant will have at least one sibling.

item.name: vita
life
item.desc: A biography of a historical person; although frequently used of medieval saints, the term may apply broadly (e.g., the vita of Aeschylus that begins the scholia)

item.name: fascicle
item.desc: One of several installments of a book or volume.

item.name: line (physical)
tei lb
item.desc: A physical line of text on the page, not to be confused with a line of poetry, which may take multiple physical lines.

item.name: side
item.desc: A side of a scriptum, such for a folio.

item.name: subcolumn
item.desc: Divisions of a column. Many early large books with two columns per page were printed with a few letters marking the vertical axis of the column, to make referencing easier. This is seen, for example, in the Patrologia Latina and Patrologia Graeca.

item.name: tome
item.desc: A large codex or book. It may be divided into volumes.

item.name: volume
item.desc: A scriptum, normally a printed book, that is a (usually numbered or labeled) member of a set of scripta, e.g., the volumes in an encyclopedia.

item.name: part
item.desc: A generic division of a larger textual unit. Can be conceptual or physical.
